Plenty of space to lay down a blanket, bring some chairs, lots of people and make a day of it. 
Great for kids.
author: Sabrina M.

description:
"It's like Dolores Park but with tons of kids instead of weed."
-a super handsome man, 2013

So many great things about it. I'll try to keep it short:

Free parking- I couldn't believe such a thing was possible!
Super lushy grass- Wanna find a lush grassy spot? Easy! Try anywhere!
Would you rather look at boats? Great! Just face the water!
Feeling like making bloody marys but don't want to go home and get everything you need to make it? - Wait for the little rolling cart people to come by and purchase a bloody mary kit!

I'm not a fancy food truck person but I am super grateful that our friends suggested it for an outing. Excellent picnic spot, perfect opportunity to try something different, and really great family-friendly environment. 

We'll be back.
author: Loli L.

description:
Very few words,, fin awesome place .. 
after u stuff ur stomach with food,, u can walk, drink or do wthever u like here or around golden gate,,,
parking is lill mess,, but if ur patient enough ,, ull find one 

dnt forget to bring some shade to put ur face under ,, if ur  dat kind of guy ,, u know wht i mean :)
author: C S.

description: About 9 trucks. But they have cabanas & camp fires to keep you warm. so get here early & there's plenty of parking. $1/hr or $6/all day. Free after 6p.
author: Christi S.

description: Loved the location, music and there were enough food/drink options without overwhelming you. Had some good pizza, some kind of yummy lemon donut hole things, and a "girl scout cookie" (samoa) creme brulee that was delicious. Also watermelon lemonade that was very tasty. If we lived in the bay area we would come to these all the time. I would recommend getting cash before you get there because both atms were out by the time we got there, but most of the vendors accepted credit cards.
author: Amanda S.

description: Beautiful sunny day, awesome view of the bay and Angel Island, large stretch of soft grass, great music, and a chill, family friendly setting (our kids could spread out for games of frisbee and catch).  Great food trucks and tents.  A perfect way to spend a summer Sunday in the greatest city on earth!
author: Joe P.

description: Big fan of Off the Grid, but never knew this existed.  A beautiful Sunday in the park with friends and our kids.  Great variety of food to select from.  Music, booze, food, friends... what more could you want?
author: Denise M.

description: Been here only once and it was a nice beautiful day.  It's a Great location and parking isn't actually bad.  As with every OTG, there were a lot of food choices, take your food, then bring a blanket to lay on the grass.  It's a family-friendly OTG spot.
author: Claire J.

description:
Came here last night hoping to grab a cabana or fire pit at Presidio but everything was taken. But the beautiful park, clear skies for an awesome view of the Golden Gate Bridge and a wide selection of food trucks made up for it. 

My girl and I got some food from Chairman Bao. We got the baked pork belly and the coca-cola braised pork bao. Both were delicious and highly recommended. 

We got a side of Kamikaze fries from KoJa Kitchen and they so not disappoint. Their are so many flavors that makes it a "go-to" item anytime. The price may be a bit steep but compared to other Korean fusion places with fries, it's definitely better in quality and quantity. 

Lastly, you can't go without trying Garden Creamery. Any gelato or ice cream flavor you get is top notch and made with local ingredients. We had maple bacon croissant, stoner milk, and ritual coffee. 

If you're a foodie, you got try going to one of the events!
author: Benjamin C.

description:
I love the Off the Grid concept, and I will argue that this is the best version in San Francisco. It encapsulates my idea of the perfect Sunday afternoon: rounding up my pals and a few blankets, staking out an idyllic patch of lush grass, and noshing until our hearts are content. The Presidio is the ideal location to escape the city without actually leaving it, and the prime selection of vendors is impressive: when I was there most recently, we sampled from both Rosamunde Sausages and Del Popolo's Pizza--two SF favorites. I guarantee there will be something there that will win over your taste buds. There's even someone who rolls around a wagon of libations for blanket-side beverage service. You CAN'T lose! 

There's a plethora of people-watching and it's super dog friendly as well. If you find yourself poised with a beautifully lazy Sunday in your hands, don't hesitate to take advantage of this pre-packaged picnic. Roll me home!
author: Meredith C.

description:
I'm a lucky gal to have gone from this year's opening weekend of Smorgasburg in Brooklyn to opening weekend of SF's Off the Grid Picnic in the Presidio within a week. I'll admit I complained about the SF food festival scene after eating in NY but the picnic was really a nice treat. The sunny weather brought all the Dolores Park and Crissy Field regulars to the Presidio. The crowd was a mix of families with kids, bros, and even some sunbathers. We knew to get there at 11 when it started and saved spots away from the vendors where it got too crowded.

We were able to order food and alcohol before the lines got crazy long and vendors ran out of food. The vendors were mainly from restaurants so it was nice to see different offerings from the usual OTG lineups. Highlights included fried chicken from Wing Wings (not offered at their shop), Del Popolo pizza (there were 3 or 4 food trucks), smoky potato salad from Whole Beast. The alcohol was expensive - beers $6?, bloody Mary's and mimosas $9-10. 

Things to bring since I was rusty on picnicking:
Blankets
Plates, cups, utensils, napkins, wet naps
Alcohol and other drinks (so you don't have to buy there)
Snacks (in case vendors run out of food or have something to eat while you're waiting)
Small bags for garbage (garbage stations emptied regularly)
Games (Sports Basement has a tent where you can rent games)

Overall, this was a well organized event. Use the restroom at the Presidio visitor center. Bring cash just in case. Maybe it was the alcohol but I spent 4 hours at the picnic. I'd definitely go back to check out other food. I only hesitate because of how crowded this event will get.
author: Mimi L.

description:
Awesomeness!!!
This is really something we are lacking in Toronto. Actual good food trucks/pop ups with a great setting, loads of green space for people to enjoy their food and good dj/music to boot.

I don't remember the names of the places, cuz we got way too much in a short time.
We had:
- Wagyu beef on garlic noodles ($15)
Loads of garlic and tender wagyu
- Fried chicken (4 large pcs @ $14)
Standout flavour, crispy skin and tender meat.
- Lemon ricotta doughnuts ($3)
Very refreshing, not too sweet.
- Ramen burger
- Croquette
- Fish tacos
Good flavour and crunch... Could only do one bite tho cuz I was way too full
- Cheese pizza ($13)
- Nutella creme brulee ($5)
A little too sweet.
- Chocolate creme brulee ($5)
Great flavour combo, a bit of sweet and tang

We were crazy full, we had to take a nap. Luckily my sister always keeps a tent and picnic mats in the car. Bonus... Beautiful view of the Golden Gate Bridge.  Loads of free parking and the beach is so close you can easily collect all your food and drive down for a picnic at the beach.

I can do this everyday!
author: Daphne L.

description:
Love it! Wish there was something like this hosted out here in LA regularly. Maybe there is and I've missed it? Please feel free to ping me if I have! 

The Presidio is beautiful, with a great view of the bay and sail boats. The grassy area was perfect for picnicking and playing. I loved how they have plenty of trash/recycle bins around and someone keeping an eye on it. It never got too full and disgusting. Thank you!

The stalls/truck in attendance all sounded good. We ended up getting a variety of things to share and it really worked out. The selection of food options was really good and every thing we tried that day was pretty good. 

I love how they have picnic/lawn game rentals, and drink wagons making their rounds on the grass. It was my first time and I didn't think to bring blankets and such... luckily my friends, local to SF, did :) But if they hadn't, I could have rented something for the day!

The crowd was fun and friendly. Doggies and kids all around. It was breezy and overcast, but the bloody mary and friendly atmosphere kept me warm.
author: Casey C.

description: Pretty cool event. We went on Labor Day weekend and the crowd was absolutely insane. Each line took about 10-15minutes, which is too long for my tastes especially for how expensive the food is. After about 3PM most of the vendors are running out of food so don't bother showing up around than because you'll be stuck with limited options. We ended up getting food at the Grille Cheez Guys and some mexican tent. Both were good, but in classic food truck fashion they used excessive amounts of butter and fat, which I am not a big fan of. My friend also ordered a mint julip and they didn't even bother putting mint in it...
author: Erik M.

description: Absolutely loved this version of OTG. Such a great way to spend a Sunday afternoon in SF , especially on a sunny summer day. Loved the food trucks and vendors, information booth was helpful. It was well planned and love the concept of a bar in the middle. Next time we will bring blankets to sit on as it seems like a nice area to relax. It's nice to see the different types of dogs as well that come by the event. Good place to bring the whole family.
author: Ellin C.

description:
I love all Off the Grid events that I've been to! Definitely a great place to try a bunch of different kinds of food at once. 

This was my first at the presidio and honestly I really wanted To go because of the tent I thought I was going to have. I wish there were more b/c there was so much lawn space in the back. Traffic and presidio being at the farthest corner of sf, we end up being late. Go early if u want the tent!! But we still caught the sunlight before it went down. It was actually a very nice day in sf! (Didn't freeze in a t shirt) Definitely love the location and that you can see the bridge and there's so much parking.

Lines were long but quick. You already know the drill. Totally worth the wait of course.

Complaints: rude sf people... The lawn is huge, can't you find another place to sit instead of right next to us? The lawn didn't even fill up to every corner. SOME PEOPLE... I just don't understand. Get out of my personal bubble. I guess there's not much OTG can do, but I hope people read this and like be more considerate. -_-
author: Katie T.

description:
Awesome event.  Great outdoor scene.

Cabanas get taken up very early.

Gets cold towards the end, so bundle up.  Bring Blankets and such.

Food lines get very very long.  So just be aware.
author: Steven F.

description:
Expensive food but pretty unique fare. 

Gotta love a place where you can openly sit and drink beers and in the park, even if you didn't buy them from the bar tent.

There's a bit of a dog/human problem. Some humans can't handle leaving their dog at home even if their dog is an asshole. They're, in fact, so ignorant that their dog is an asshole that they seem to misunderstand leash straining, aggressive barking for something cute because they softly pet their asshole dog while saying sweetly, "you're ok, you're ok, awwwww."

Because of this dog/human problem, I'll never bring my dog here. I'm just not willing to subject my old girl to possible harassment.

Other than that, I'd go back to hang out and enjoy some sweet SF fog and beers on the lawn.
author: Andy W.

description: This place is AMAZING. Very San Francisco. Enjoy beautiful views of the Golden Gate Bridge and beautiful historical buildings of Crissy Fields while chowing down on various food from the plethora of food trucks and vendors on the grounds. Bring your picnic blanket, wine, and healthy appetite and enjoy the food. Amazing food, music and fun. Note that this is a seasonal event and for 2015 the final day will be November 1st but there's always 26!!. Its a must visit event and very close to other nearby attractions.
author: Jermaine J.

description:
Cool event, but I'm not sure the food is worth the trek. The Presidio is so far out of the way. Took us forever to get there, so we only had like 15 minutes of live music and the food trucks started closing around 8:50. 

I tried a couple food trucks, and they were solid but not 5-stars. I liked the vibe of everyone chilling outdoors (even though it was definitely less than 50 degrees in June) to live music, food trucks, and the gorgeous view. They should have a few more bonfires and cabanas for other people, especially those in smaller groups!
author: Kimberly Y.

description: Off the hook! Music booth/dj + 2 bars + endless supply of food- what more could you want?!I was a little unprepared and didn't bring any blankets/towels or umbrellas (for shade in 90 degree weather), but there is ample green space to sit and relax with your food. I tried as many trucks as I had room for- which ended up being around 4, including: cholita, porteno, three twins ice cream and the stone-fire pizza (forget the name). Everything was great! ATM on site but most places (if not all) take cards. Also comes with a great view (on a nice day). You have to go!
author: Melissa P.

description: Great place to spend Sunday afternoon, plenty of food and drink stalls, especially the food trucks. Can get pretty busy, with long lines at popular food places and finding a parking spot can take time. But worth the extra effort to spend the afternoon in a picnic area over a few drinks, good food, great view of the bay, and people watching.
author: Ninad S.

description: This is a great idea! If only they had more tents and "camp fires"! It's great for friends and family to gather along around a fire or a couple to cuddle under a tent while enjoying a live band and the company of good people! The trucks all line up and the grass area just gets filled! I suggest you come very early, my friends went 10min before the suggested timeeverything started up and all the tents were filled but luckily they got seats around one of the little camp fire like things. Oh and it gets windy don't forget it's SF so when they say bring a light blanket, bring one!!!!
author: Rosh E.

description:
Key places to try here:

Del Popolo: averages $11-$15 a pie, Margherita for $11 and Bianca $12, spend that extra $1 and get the Bianca
Go Streatery: ZEPPOLES!!! amazing little lemony nuggets of fried dough. I personally didn't taste any ricotta cheese in it, which is a good thing. $3 for avg of 6-7 pieces 
(I also tried their oxtail and grits and perhaps grits is not something I enjoy, but their oxtail is fall of the bone tender & yummy. Don't be deceived by the pictures here though, that plate is NOT that big) 

and if you're willing to splurge ... WINGS WINGS!! These wings are ridiculously expensive to be quite frank. $14 for 4 pieces. or $28 for 8 pieces. Shit. I hope I'm eating gold or something. I wouldn't say they're bad, because they're certainly VERY big chunks of fried chicken and during the afternoon, with long lines for dayz, they pump it out fast. However, fried chicken is fried chicken. Beware of that orange hot sauce though, SCREAMS FIRE!!

tip: ask trucks for foil so you can cover your food without it going cold when you're still in line for ..everything else.
BYOB! you'll thank me for spending that extra cash on more food trucks
& bring a blanket :) not always lucky to enjoy nice/sunny days at the Presidio
author: Sandra L.

description:
I've been to off the grid: fort mason but just recently came to this one last sunday.

Not as many food trucks / stands as you would think but they did have variety. There were food stands on one side, the farmers market on the other, and the drink booths in between. Everything is always pricey (but what do you expect from San Francisco). The drink booths were walking around with little carts doing refills which I thought was pretty cool. Crowded as usual, but worrying about a place on the grass is not a problem. There are many places to just plop down and enjoy the event. Make sure to bring a blanket/chairs or be prepared to sit on the grass because there isn't any seating anywhere. They had a DJ going and the vibe was fun. 

We ordered some fish tacos from one of the stands (forgot the name) but it was delicious. Grabbed a couple oysters - which I was surprised to see because I've never seen any at all the off the grid locations I've been too. They were really good as well.

Overall: Great experience. Would definitely come back. Great place to bring your kids or friends/family and relax.
author: Kristel L.

description: love love love coming to Off the Grid at the Presidio especially on a beautiful Sunday. You can bring food and drink OR buy it. Its family friendly or just friend friendly. Really you cant go wrong with a view of the bay, sunshine, great food and drink, and awesome friends.
author: Kristan B.

description: Me, the hubby and almost two month old decided to venture over to this event. First off the view is amazing. You can see the GG Bridge in clear view and on a hot day it seriously incredible. The booths themselves are delish but be prepared to waiittttt. Each one has at least a 20 min wait but its worth it. Luckily we brought some snacks since we didn't want to wait in more than one booth. There are people of all ages and everyone is in such a great mood. I recommend this to anyone and think it is the best OFG by far. I will be coming back for sure a few times more this year.
author: Bri R.

description:
Fantastic event! I'm a regular at the Off The Grid in Palo Alto but was in San Francisco for the weekend so I came here to check it out. I brought my girl and invited another lady friend and we loved this venue. Its gorgeous, the view of the Bay, the island and passing sailboats is spectacular. Its a gigantic lawn so you can sit anywhere, the trucks and booths surround two sides of the lawn so food is always a few steps away. There is a huge selection of food so there is definite something for everyone. You can bring your own lawn chairs, blankets and umbrellas or you can do like we did and rent them from the Off The Grid Information Booth.

There is a DJ playing music and a (pay) parking lot right there so its a lovely, perfect picnic place.

Their lawn chairs are especially cozy so we lounged in the shade and sun, talked, laughed, played hula hoops and ate wonderful food. this is a great event and you really have to check it out before the winter hiatus, its really that good. Then come over Off The Grid Palo Alto and dance with us (we get live music every Monday night), we are easy to find, me and my girl will be the ones singing and dancing to the musician.
author: Bob L.

description:
I love Off the Grid and especially Off the Grid at the Presidio! When its a nice hot summer day, nothing is better than laying out in the sun with some oysters from Hogs & Rocks, a okonomiyaki w/ a fried egg on top from Namu Gaji, and some lemon ricotta donuts from Streatery. 

I've been Picnic at the Presidio twice and each time I seem to crave for the same things, but then again, it's just goooood! Enjoy the food, enjoy the sun. It'll make for a great Sunday Funday!
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
Went for Mother's Day 2014 and had a great day.  get there early because parking is tough.  Absolutely get the frozen mimosas were AMAZING!!!!!!!  and who doesn't love kettle corn or sausage? 

bonus points for the beautiful setting and photo opps w/ the golden gate bridge....
author: Margarita P.

description: You already know! What a great and chill time. The food can get $$$$$$ but it's San Francisco. I do like sitting on the ground eating noodles though. Not a lot of places to sit in the grass eating noodles or whatever else surrounded by all sorts of chill people without a care in the world. Good views, too.
author: Jenna B.

description: On a nice sunday, this is a great place to get together with some friends for a bite, a drink and just chill out on the grass.  There is a good selection of food places, a bar, a dj, and an amazing view of the bay.  Why wouldn't you want to be here?
author: Dilly M.

description: If the Chairman is there, ALWAYS get it. Seriously, the steamed pork belly with pickled daikon is crazy good. Or better yet, don't get it so the line is shorter for me. But this is the coolest off the grid I have seen. They have chairs and fire pits and canopies available, plus plenty of parking.
author: Tara M.

description:
As a former Bay Area girl, Off the Grid: Picnic At the Presidio is one of those summertime events that makes me miss living in this part of California. 

This particular location of OtG is perfect for those looking to have a lazy Sunday with a nice view of the bay and Golden Gate Bridge (if not covered in fog). Located near the Walt Disney Museum, it can be a bit of trek to get to without a car (for those with a car there's a giant parking lot). 

Reasons to love this: 
1. Large grassy area for picnicking; lots of families with cute kids and dogs running around 
2. Little red wagons selling bloody marys and beer
3. Bins for composting/recycling/trash--- the inner environerd in me loves how this is just standard practice here
4. The food! If you're in the mood for tacos, Cholita Linda is an excellent choice for fish tacos (2 for $8); the batter was light and I like that they use flour tortillas. They also accept credit/debit via Square!! Love it 

If you're in the mood for nachos, hands down Napalito is the place to hit up; the chips are nice ad thick made from fresh tortillas, dipped in their housemade salsa and then topped with a generous sprinkling of cotija cheese. My friends and I inhaled them while waiting in line for other food and immediately came to the conclusion that we needed to get another order stat. 

After our tummies were nice and stuffed, we layed in the fresh grass and relaxed taking in the sounds of giggling children and feeling the cool ocean breeze against our skin. 

ATM machine on this particular visit was broken, and the only sad part was when humphry slocombe ran out of most of the ice cream flavors later into the afternoon.
author: Leslie T.

description: A fun thing to do. Parking can be a pain so be prepared to look around. They have good food truck presence so you will have a lot of options especially for vegetarians. Make a picnic out of it, and carry stuff to sit around, shade would be very helpful. The wait times are getting longer and longer as this spot gets more popular, so wouldn't hurt to carry back enough food in one trip.
author: Ashish K.

description:
Great concept, but I wish they would review their food vendors before just letting some of them in to sell - high prices that rip off customers.  

DO NOT  waste your $$ at little green cyclo - not good, food tastes like its pre-made and been sitting all day to hand off at over priced rates.

I do like the bacon chocolate booth and Kasa Indian, wood fired pizza was great too.
author: Veronica R.

description:
The Off the Grid picnic is my favorite of any SF food truck gathering's that I've been to.  It's super well organized.  The Presidio lawn is a great place to have this.  Theres even a parking lot, because lets face it, taking muni into the presidio is a pain in the ass. 

Unlike some other off the grids, this one is not limited to just trucks.  Many local restaurants also set up booths to sell their delicious offerings.  Check the website ahead of time to see what trucks/restaurants will be there, bring a blanket to sit on, and prepare to chow down!
author: Steven Z.

description: Definitely one of my favorite Sunday shenanigans. Bring your group, a blanket to sit on, and your appetite! Great selection of food trucks: variety of different cuisine, dessert trucks, and of course the bubble bar for some drinks! Relax on a nice Sunday outside with live music, a view of the bay and GG bridge, and be prepared to see some cute dogs. Very kid and dog friendly, so it's perfect for the whole fam!
author: Amanda C.

description: Great idea to house Off the Grid at the Presidio in the big grassy area.  Come here early and it won't be too difficult to grab a nearby parking space otherwise be ready to walk a little bit.  They have a good variety of food trucks, a drink tent, a farmer's market area and a DJ playing music.  Perfect for a family with kids or for anyone wanting to get out and grab some delicious food.  I had a salmon burger and my wife had probably the most amazing roast turkey sandwich I've ever had.
author: Blake B.

description:
Fun stop for sure! We did not plan on attending, but rather, happened upon it after we traveled out to the Presidio to visit the Walt Disney Family Museum :)

We had some good meals from the food trucks (I had a sandwich from the Streatery) and overall, just a nice vibe :D
author: Krissy M.

description: Super fun and delicious choices.  Wing Wing's fried chicken was excellent.  Nopolitos ginger lemonade a thirst quencher.  Nice to see so many people...families...friends hanging out and eating well.
author: Nancy M.

description: What a great way to spend Sunday's! Bring a blanket, a bottle of champagne + orange juice, scope around for food and your set. This place is perfect to relax and have a picnic with friends, family or your significant other. There's a lot of vendors to choose from and it seems like they change from time to time. I tried the bacon wrapped mochi from Chotto, mushroom empanada from El Porteno and the fried chicken with biscuits from Wing Wings. Everything was delicious. I love how theres so much to choose from. I guess I know how I'll be spending my Sunday's.
author: Laura T.

description:
my review will reflect similar sentiments my better half Andy W. has recently expressed in his review, so I apologize in advance for any redundancies.

First timers here end of August...and then once more Sunday.  Perfect summer days to go into SF, the weather both times were excellent.  First time we had to battle Americas Cup traffic; this past time, we had the breast cancer 2day walk instead.  So needless to say, leave ample driving time!

parking in August weekend was considerably easier than it was the first time around, woo whoo.  we usually lay out on a patch of grass somewhat near the DJ station, and really anywhere is a good spot, with lots of space for all.  The dog scenario is insane, I would not bring my dog here, I think too many folks bring unruly dogs that shouldn't be around so many people and children.  they just let the dogs run around too with no leash, not cool.

ANYYYWAAAAY... Onto the main attraction: the FOOOOOD.  Oh and they serve booze here too, cool.  The first time I landed on the taco tent.  I tried a pork and a fish.  I was surprised that I like the fish more than the pork...sweet!  I'd wanted something sweet to finish it off and went with the crème brulee tent...bc sadly, the ice cream guys only had a lavender ice cream left, weak.  But my crème brulee with fruit was good.

Trip #2 Sunday was better as it was much less crowded.  I made my way over to Popolu: the brick oven food truck.  It had the longest line around so naturally, I had to give it a whirl.  Limited menu...margarita pizza, a bianca pizza (no sauce, but includes mozzerella ricotta garlic and basil,) and then some other one.  all priced about $11-12, add $2.50 for stinking pepperoni!  after plopping down $25 for 2 pies, i will say it was a decent value, but wish they had more options for toppings...like fresh jalapenos! regardless, i loved the crust; super yum.

all in all, worth the wait...which wasnt all that bad.  they take your order halfway through the line so by the time you're at the front, it's ready to go.  check um out for sure if you want a solid pie!!

oh and everyone else loved the pizza too, yay :)
author: Sara W.

description:
FUN, FUN,and more FUN.  Love going to the Off The Grid Picnic where you can can eat to your hearts content and relax all at the same time.  OMG the brown sugar and pepper biscuit I had was to die for.  Not quite a biscuit, not quite a cake but absolutely delicious.  The view was fantastic and just a rip roaring good time for all.   
This is the place to let your taste buds cut loose and have a good time. Some they love. some they will not.  But I bet if you are a foodie you will go back for more.
author: GG V.

description: Great place for a Sunday Funday!! Food, views and entertainment. Parking can suck, but worth it. Something new and different to try out. Bring your own blanket and a cooler it can get pricy if you don't plan right.
author: Patricia G.

description: Off the Grid at the Presidio has an amazing variety of food, a friendly environment and lovely view of the Golden Gate Bridge. I love the Argentinean empanadas El Sur--very authentic! The chicken empanadas are the best, but the meat empanadas are very good as well.
author: Magoo M.

description: What a lovely pkace to hang out and try many different food on a Sunday afternoon. Chill people, great atmosphere. Tried some amazing bbq pulled pork sandwich and the famous pizza Napolitano truck, everything was delicious. Too bad that they close at 4pm. Parking can be difficult!
author: Francesca L.

description: Perfect way to spend Sunday Funday! Bring your friends, family, dogs, booze, and a blanket and hang out on the lawn. Tons of food and drink options including champagne bar, cocktails, and mobile beer cart. The only thing that was missing was the sunshine!
author: Stephanie M.

description: Perfect place if u like to eat lunch truck or other local foods,drinks,specialties.  You sit out in a grass field bring a blanket or lawn chair. There is music and beer also. View of the bay and lots of family's and friends.  Great place to chill and try different food. TIP. Bring a cooler with your fav brew or mix.  Parking can be a pain but it's the city what's new
author: Mr. B.

description:
Great location for off the grid.  

At this location, there is both trucks and well labeled tents.  Definitely hit the liquor booth- the Bloody Mary's are bomb. 
We ate at the wing booth and the empanadas booths.  The wings were delicious.  I ordered both the carne and mushroom empanadas- I would recommend just grabbing the carne and pass on the mushroom. 
Sunday Funday!
author: Christine B.

description: So much fun! It was my first time experiencing the picnic and it was fantastic. I work in the bay, but haven't had a lot of time to play. Today was awesome for that reason. So many food vendors to choose from! We arrived right around 11am and had no issue with parking. We grabbed some grub, spread out on our blanket and enjoyed the view of the bay as the day was exceptionally clear. This is a great place to bring out of towners as it will leave a lasting impression. It does get pretty crowded later in the day, but I do think it's totally worth it.
author: Shelly T.

description: Always fun here at the otg presidio. It is more a family/chill with friends on the grass type of day. You can rent some outdoor games from the sports basement tent, and there's usually a dj playing as well. Fun day!
author: E B.

description: Awesome location, every kind of food you could want, what more could you ask for?  The lines can look pretty long, but everything moves pretty quickly.  With music, booze, and tons of people it's a great way to spend a Sunday afternoon.  The only problem you could run into is places running out of food towards the end of the day, but even then there's always something else to try!
author: Angus R.

description:
I head to picnic in the presidio whenever I have a free Sunday....I bring a new friend each time....since most people haven't heard of this! 
It can be funny to get to, but once are there it's fantastic!
Drink white wine on the grass, eat your heart out, plus go home with fresh produce and flowers!
I think her name was Lariena (oops!) from Home.Sweet.Flowers. Anyway, she was super sweet and her flowers were gorgeous. Plus, wrapped in burlap.
Nice way to reuse.
Also.... be sure to get strawberries from Daniel & Joseph at Blue House.
author: Diane V.

description:
Met a few families there at opening weekend - packed by noon.  Pretty crazy lines and food waits but everything we had was worth it.  Pork belly sliders at Haven, 4 piece fried chicken at Wings (30 minute total wait but still worth it), secret breakfast (bourbon) ice cream from Humphrey Slocumbe.  

Plenty of room for playtime after the little ones finished covering themselves in farmers market strawberry gore, but beware the grass if you allow little (or big ones) to tackle you into it - fertilizer gets itchy fast.
author: Andrew F.

description: It is worth the drive to come here. Bring a kite and a friend. This place is wonderful. Take pictures and have fun.
author: Ronald N.

description: These guys are proof there is still good in the world. The roster is never dissapointing and everyone seems to be genuinely happy to be there.
author: Tim H.

description: So it is was SUPER cold on the day i came BUT luckily, everyone was so nice and was more than willing to share their little fire. I like this OTG because they have cabanas and fire pits which was totally cute. The line up for food trucks isn't as extensive to the one on Fridays at Fort Mason. I don't remember the two trucks i made purchases at but it was pretty good. I just remember it was Asian fusion - one had steak cubes and the other had pork belly. Hmmmm pork belly... i will definitely come again - with more layers and more friends because this is definitely a neat spot to just kick it.
author: Kristina L.

description:
I couldn't think of a better way to spend my Columbus Day weekend than at this picnic.  We got a good view of the Blue Angels, there was tons of parking, it was sunny, there was plenty of room and it was just an all-around great time.  It's great for kids, dogs, couples, families, seniors and everyone!

The food was delicious! My boyfriend and I shared a nice lunch consisting of a few things from different vendors.  We tried the cheese and baguette from one place and a sausage trio from another to have a little meat, cheese and bread lunch.

I saw some vendors were selling alcohol, which is awesome!  We'll have to try the drinks next time.

*Warning! Yes, some vendors take credit cards but make sure to bring cash just in case.  One of the vendors was having a hard time getting cell coverage to process our card.
author: Nic E.

description: I love this OTG! Go early to get a seat in the cabana or fire pits. The food selection is great. I had no line at chairman of bao. At fort mason its impossible to have no line. Its a really cool atmosphere but gets chilly at night. Bring warm clothes
author: Megan C.

description: The lawn can be a bit soggy but as long as you bring an adequate picnic blanket then everything will be fine. The food, music, and atmosphere for a Sunday in the Presidio is a relaxing way to end your hectic weekends. Be sure to try a few different foods and drinks but feel free to bring your own stuff too. Also parking is easy and cheap. See you there!
author: Gil A.

description: Let's see...screaming kids, lousy blaring music, overpriced food trucks, and peeing dogs all over an immaculate lawn...what could be wrong?  A more appropriate question might be "who thought this would be a good idea"?  I don't know about anybody else, but I go to the park to escape crowds and noise...a very poor use of public land, and whoever agreed to the idea from the Presidio Trust should be reprimanded or released from their duties.
author: Sally Q.

description: What a wonderful way to spend a Sunday! Can't wait to go back. Had tacos from Cholita Linda - so good. Excited to explore more options in the future!
author: Audrey A.

description:
love it!

loads of great options in a wonderful atmosphere. can't wait to go back - its the perfect sunday!
author: Stephanie M.

description: When it's a nice day, this place is an awesome way to spend a Sunday afternoon.   So many choices of food to satisfy any palate.  Fried Chicken,  pizza,  grilled cheeses, ice cream,  etc.   Don't forget to bring a blanket so you can relax and enjoy the Sunday afternoon in the cool San Francisco breeze.   Big plus is that I didn't seem to have any problem finding parking.
author: Conrad S.

description: Bring your picnic blankets, foldable chairs, and football because this is going to be a great Sunday well spent! Lots of great food to choose from. I'm even more happy that Nopalito is there, too. Don't forget to enjoy the view.
author: Malou M.

description: I've been to Off the Grid in the Presidio twice now... In fact, two weekends in a row because we loved it so much. Lots of places to throw a blanket down with friends and chill. So many delicious food options (although the later you get here, the longer the line to wait for just about everything, also bring cash. There's an ATM and plenty of places take a card, but wouldn't want to miss some great food for this reason!). We've always brought our own beverages, but there are also lots of options of delicious drinks to buy too. Great place to chill for a nice sunny Sunday Funday with friends. Also a great place to bring visitors of all ages.
author: Kailey C.

description: Fun afternoon with friends. Cool bar area, lots of options for food. The music could be a little bit better.
author: Kelly K.

description:
I like to patronize the trucks around town and get to OTG events now and then.  This was my first visit to the Picnic.  Great setting.  Not enough trucks on this occasion - waits were pretty long and there was one truck, Smokeys, where it was over an hour to get a so-so tri-tip sandwich and they let the other part of the order get cold.  Sorry but you need to be prepared for the rush if you are going to do this!  Something was clearly not going right with that truck and I hope they fix it, the menu looked promising.  The 3 other trucks provided great variety but still they all looked very stressed, this was not representative of a good OTG meetup.
We enjoyed  the other vendors and stalls that were present, chocolate makers,  a few farms, cheese, the creme brulee (they also suffered a very long production process and we had to pass once it looked like another long wait).
Lots of dogs and most well behaved but I'd suggest some protocol be 'enforced' before its left to pepper spray and yelling.
author: Peter R.

description: Old world food truck has tastiest schnitzel with sweet sauce and juicy triangle dumplings called pierogi. Streatery has delicious lemon doughnuts.
author: Lyuba F.

description:
it's nice place to picnic on a weekend, but SF is always so windy and cold. sitting there eating food truck wasn't very pleasant. there are a lot of big dogs around, which scare me :(

I got cream brûlée cart here, although they're in FI-DI everyday, i never got to buy them. it was good - S'more flavor which they don't sell in FI-DI (only basic flavor in FI-DI, like vanilla, chocolate, etc.). I also bought the most disgusting ramen burger from NOMBE, almost wanted to throw up cuz of the grease of this burger, and the disgusting ramen flavor and miso flavor (it just doesn't taste like miso at all). don't waste your $10!!!
author: Ashley C.

description: fun. food is good. there are lots of different things to try. they have a beer stand so you can drink on this huge lawn. most stands take credit cards but there is an atm close by. there are porter potties available. but i know a secret bathroom. : ) . try the frozen mimosa. they are 10 bucks a pop, but somehow i feel like it is worth it.
author: Jon C.

description: Woo Hoo! Great food, Friendly people. I can wait for next year. As chill as it gets. Dog friendly and the girls aren't stuck up. They actually smile and talk to you like a person. Im going to spend way more time here next year!
author: Mario A.

description: This place was such a good time and the weather couldn't have been better. Betty and I started off with a bloody Mary each which not overly strong, but it was tasty. There's  a good variety of vendors and the prices are your typical food truck prices.  Bring a blanket and some cash and hopefully the weather cooperates. If out does you're sure to have a good time.
author: Bob B.

description: I stopped by the Presidio picnic after running bay to breakers. I was famished when I arrived. I really appreciated seeing booths with food from restaurants and not all food trucks. I also loved the booze tent! I had one of the "presidio mules" which was a twist on a Moscow mule, it was quite tasty.  This will be a great off the grid to attend while the weather is nice.
author: Stephanie T.

description: You'll find me here on Sundays a lil more often.  This event is awesome.  We came with some friends, family & kids....and we had a great time.  The music set a good vibe, I love how it is totally kid friendly, and there are so many tasty beverages, food & treats to choose from.  If your in the area on Sunday and want something chill to do, definitely check this event out.  Good times all around.
author: Natacha M.

description: Sweet (kid-friendly) place for food truck fun and farmers market combined, on a picnic lawn with views of the bay!  (Today that means te Americas Cup!)
author: Sp S.

description: Not for you if you want healthy food from farms that treat animals well, or organic hormone-free antibiotic-free ingredients of any kind. Also was very very cold and windy. We went n and left hungry and cold. View was great though!
author: Erin M.

description: Go to hang out with friends on a nice day, but don't expect good food.  Maybe I'm just jaded but, the whole food truck thing is over-rated.  I actually like a lot of the restaurants that have trucks at Off the Grid/ Picnic at the Presidio, but somehow food prepared in a truck just isn't the same....not even close...unless it's ice cream or dessert.  I got a pulled pork sandwich from Wexler that was dry and tasteless.  My BF got some oxtail egg thingy that was forgettable.  The only highlight was dessert.  We got some doughnut thingy from the oxtail egg place (forgot the name) and it was heaven!  Oh, and be prepared to wait in line FOREVER.
author: Wendy S.

description: A great way to spend a Sunday afternoon. Plenty of awesome food trucks, beer and wine, and family friendly activities.
author: Chris S.

description: Low key music festival, awesome, but how do you reserve a tent?? Please answer asap!! :)
author: Luana G.

description: Thursday night Twilight (April 2), total fail. Ridiculously packed with not nearly enough food trucks to serve the crowds.
author: Greg C.

description: Stag Dining, The Brooklyn Circus, an amazing DJ, drink service , what more could you ask for?!
author: Anthony C.

description: What a fun event. Spent all day here for the Labor Day holiday and had great food, drinks and weather.  The frozen mimosa was delicious and I got good from several trucks all were great. Tip is to order early as several trucks sold out well before 4pm.  Also it was very dog friendly. Parkin was a bit tough
author: Ashley P.

description: All I can say is: DAMN!  This is a gem!  I'm in the city with a group from my college studying urban planning, and we were wandering around the Presidio and happened to stumble across this event, and of course we all decided that it was more important to enjoy the food trucks and beautiful weather than to discuss the history of the area.  I chose to order a pizza from Del Popolo, which at $12 for a small pie seemed cringe-worthy, but it was honestly the best pizza I have ever tasted in my life and was worth every cent.  I also tried the ice cream from Three Twins, which was also tasty, and some of my fellow students sampled other offerings from different food trucks, and we all agreed that Off the Grid: Picnic At the Presidio will definitely be one of the highlights of our trip...
author: Mick W.

description: After a $25 cab ride, I was expecting a little bit more.  Maybe it was the muggy weather or the high drink prices, but I thought something was missing.  Even though there was a decent selection of food, I was expecting to have many more food truck options.  I was looking forward to some Vietnamese tacos and cupcakes, but looks like either the trucks rotate or these options are at another Off the Grid location.  I also heard there was supposed to be music there but didn't hear that either.  There are two drink stations there (one on each side of the lawn) and they serve wine, beer, bloodies, and mimosas.  The drink prices are steep--expect $10 for a glass of wine.  I would say bring your own picnic with snacks and drinks if planning to stay for a few hours.  All in all, it's a great family and friends gathering space, but I would think twice about coming all the way here again.  Definitely bring your beach/lawn blanket and cash!
author: Tanichka B.
